oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marketing Dairy Herd Health
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Britt, Jenks S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dairy farmers
herd health
problem cows
Mastitis
Disease
Production
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Most dairy farmers are faced with financial obligations that require maximized production schemes to reach the level of profit to pay these obligations. Culling without herd health control is usually done by culling disease problem cows first:The others would be-1. Mastitis2. Non-breeders3. Disease4. Injury5. Low Production6. Temperament7. Dairy PurposesFarmers don't profit from visits from veterinarians to treat many of the above problems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1986; 42-43
